snippet: Federal authorities said that some of the spoils from a $230 million tax fraud in Russia were laundered through the purchase of luxury condos and commercial spaces.
abstract: Federal authorities are seeking forfeiture of expensive Manhattan real estate tied to a fraud that they say was uncovered by whistle-blowing Russian lawyer before he died behind bars; complaint filed against assets of Cyprus-based real estate corporation and other holding companies claims some proceeds from $230 million tax fraud in Russia were laundered through purchase of four luxury condominiums in a Wall Street doorman building.
lead_paragraph: Federal authorities said that some of the spoils from a $230 million tax fraud in Russia were laundered through the purchase of luxury condos and commercial spaces.

headline.main: U.S. Seeks Forfeiture of Manhattan Real Estate Tied to Fraud
headline.print_headline: U.S. Seeks Forfeit of Manhattan Real Estate Tied to Fraud
